At a time when our discourse has become so sharply polarized- at a time when we are far too eager to lay the blame for all that ails the world at the feet of those who happen to think differently than we do- it's important for us to pause for a moment and make sure that we're talking with each other in a way that heals, not in a way that wounds, he said. months tells NRO the conservative Hoosier "was extremely torn while he deliberated." Another who met with Mike Pence feels his heart was never completely in a bid for president. Someone close to Mike Pence explains that the people closest to him, the friends and people he knew best from Indiana, wanted to see him come back to Indiana. By contrast, "the support for him to run nationally was in large part from leaders of the national conservative movement"- who perhaps didn't have the same sway as his longtime supporters.
